alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued July 15 at 9:49PM EDT until July 16 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Little to no inundation above ground level will occur along shorelines and tidal waterways (6.8 to 7.0 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Charleston and Coastal Colleton Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads in downtown Charleston. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 10:38 PM today at Charleston. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/10 PM 6.9 1.1 0.4 N/A None 16/11 AM 5.8 0.0 0.4 N/A None 16/11 PM 6.8 1.0 0.5 N/A None 17/12 PM 6.0 0.2 0.5 N/A None 18/12 AM 6.6 0.8 0.6 N/A None 18/01 PM 6.2 0.4 0.7 N/A None &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
